title: "Brown's Court" Font ID
content:
I believe the type is hand-drawn (based on the 'o' and 'r'), but does anyone know a script font that is close in style? Help would be greatly appreciated, thanks! [http://brownscourt.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/brownscourt.com/ "http://brownscourt.com/") Logo attached

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Image%202013.02.21%206:25:53%20PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/typophile.com/files/Image%202013.02.21%206:25:53%20PM.png) | 78.92 KB |
author: trashrockx

comments.content: There's probably some good ones for this script but as I can't spot any, here are some I like: [Satisfy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/neapolitan/satisfy-pro/), [Apricot](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/apricot/), [Lavanderia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=lavanderia), [Machiarge](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/), [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/metroscript/), [Dancing Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.impallari.com/dancing), [Pacifico](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071959/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/pacifico)

Those are great! Thanks Ryuk.

If anyone has more script fonts to recommend, they would be appreciated.
